Experiment#

class Trace#

This class helps to collect the trajectories of the agents during an experiment.

get_task_events(agent: navground.sim.NativeAgent) → memoryview#

The recorded events logged by the task of an agent as memory view to the floating point buffer:

[[data_0, ...], 
 ...]

of shape (number events, size of event log).

The view is empty if the agent’s task has not been recorded in the trace.

Parameters:

agent – The agent

Returns:

The events logged by the agent task

index_of_agent(agent: navground.sim.NativeAgent) → int | None#
property collisions#
Type:

memoryview

The recorded collisions between pairs of entities as a memory view to the uint32 buffer:

[[time_step, entity 1 uid, entity 1 uid], 
 ...]

of shape (number of collisions, 3).

The view is empty if collisions have not been recorded in the trace.

property commands#
Type:

memoryview

The recorded commands of the agents as a memory view to the floating point buffer:

[[[agent_0_x, agent_0_y, agent_0_theta], 
 [agent_1_x, agent_1_y, agent_1_theta], 
  ...], 
 ...]

of shape (simulation steps, number of agents, 3).

The view is empty if commands have not been recorded in the trace.

property number#
Type:

int

The number of agents recorded

property poses#
Type:

memoryview

The recorded poses of the agents as a memory view to the floating point buffer:

[[[agent_0_x, agent_0_y, agent_0_theta], 
  [agent_1_x, agent_1_y, agent_1_theta], 
  ...], 
 ...]

of shape (simulation steps, number of agents, 3).

The view is empty if poses have not been recorded in the trace.

property record_cmd#
Type:

bool

Whether it should record the agents control commands

property record_collisions#
Type:

bool

Whether it should record collisions

property record_pose#
Type:

bool

Whether it should record the agents poses

property record_safety_violation#
Type:

bool

Whether it should record safety violations

property record_target#
Type:

bool

Whether it should record the agents targets

property record_task_events#
Type:

bool

Whether it should record data from task events

property record_twist#
Type:

bool

Whether it should record the agents twists

property safety_violations#
Type:

memoryview

The recorded amounts of safety violation”) as a memory view to the floating point buffer:

[[agent_0_violation, agent_1_violation, ...],
 ...]

of shape (simulation steps, number of agents) and where a value of 0 represents no violations.

The view is empty if safety violations have not been recorded in the trace.

property steps#
Type:

int

The number of steps recorded

property targets#
Type:

memoryview

The recorded targets of the agents as a memory view to the floating point buffer:

[[[agent_0_x, agent_0_y, agent_0_theta], 
  [agent_1_x, agent_1_y, agent_1_theta], 
  ...], 
 ...]

of shape (simulation steps, number of agents, 3).

The view is empty if targets have not been recorded in the trace.

property twists#
Type:

memoryview

The recorded twist of the agents as a memory view to the floating point buffer:

[[[agent_0_x, agent_0_y, agent_0_theta], 
  [agent_1_x, agent_1_y, agent_1_theta], 
  ...], 
 ...]

of shape (simulation steps, number of agents, 3).

The view is empty if twist have not been recorded in the trace.

class Experiment#

An experiment supervises the execution of a simulation.

It initializes a simulation and run it while collecting the desired data with Trace.

Use run_once() to perform a single run.

Use run() to perform all runs, optionally saving the data to a HDF5 dataset.

__init__(time_step: float = 0.1, steps: int = 1000) → None#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • time_step – The simulation time step

  • steps – The number of simulation steps

add_callback(callback: Callable[[], None]) → None#

Adds a callback to be executed after each simulation step.

Parameters:

value – The callback

run() → None#

Perform all runs

The number of runs is specified by runs.

If save_directory not empty but points to an existing directory, it creates a HDF5 file <name>_<timestamp>/data.h5 with attributes

  • begin_time [string], ISO 8601 formatted string of the time when the experiment is run, see begin_time;

  • duration_ns [unsigned], total duration in nanoseconds, see duration_ns.

  • experiment [string], YAML serialization of the experiment;

Moreover, at the end of each run, it saves a group run_<index> with attributes:

  • duration_ns [unsigned], total duration in nanoseconds, see run_duration_ns;

  • seed [unsigned];

  • steps [unsigned], actual number of steps performed;

  • world [string], YAML serialization of the world at the begin of the experiment.

datasets:

  • cmds [float] (if Trace.record_cmd is set);

  • collisions [unsigned] (if Trace.record_collisions is set);

  • poses [float] (if Trace.record_pose is set);

  • targets [float] (if Trace.record_target is set);

  • twists [float] (if Trace.record_twist is set);

and groups:

  • task_events (if Trace.record_task_events is set), where each agents logs, in dataset agent_<uid> [float], the events emitted by their task.

A part from saving data to the HDF5 file, each run is performed similarly to run_once().

run_once(seed: int) → None#

Perform a single run

  1. it initializes a world from its scenario by calling Scenario.init_world()

  2. it runs the simulation, step by step, collecting data in trace.

Parameters:

seed – The index (and random seed) of the run

start() → None#

Start recording

This is only need to use an external run-loop, where you call update() explicitly to update the trace without updating the simulation itself. Use run() instead, to both run the simulation and record the trace.

Call start() only once per experiment.

start_run(seed: int, init_world: bool = False) → None#

Start recording

This is only need to use an external run-loop, where you call update() explicitly to update the trace without updating the simulation itself. Call once at the start of each run.

Parameters:

  • seed – The random seed

  • init_world – Whether it should initialize a new world

stop() → None#

Stop the recording

See start(). This is only need to use an external run-loop.

stop_run() → None#

Stop the run recording

See start_run(). This is only need to use an external run-loop.

update() → None#

Updates the trace.

See start(). Call from an external run-loop to update the trace without updating the simulation itself.

property begin_time#
Type:

datetime.datetime

The time when the experiment began.

property duration#
Type:

datetime.timedelta

The duration required to perform the whole experiment.

property name#
Type:

str

The name of the experiment

property path#
Type:

Optional[os.PathLike]

The path where the experimental data has been saved.

property run_duration#
Type:

datetime.timedelta

The duration required to perform the last run (excludes initialization).

property run_index#
Type:

int

The index of the next run

property runs#
Type:

int

Number of runs to perform

property save_directory#
Type:

os.PathLike

Where to save the results

property scenario#
Type:

navground::sim::Scenario

The scenario

property steps#
Type:

int

Maximal number of steps per run

property time_step#
Type:

float

Simulation time step

property trace#
Type:

navground.sim.Trace

The current trace

previous

Cross on a Torus

next
